text: Going on a tangent about the owl meme thing. I feel like I often make this kind of mistake. Writing something half-way and forget about my target audience or just cannot be bothered to explain more and proceed to blast through all the technical stuff.

elements.text: Going on a tangent about the owl meme thing. I feel like I often make this kind of mistake. Writing something half-way and forget about my target audience or just cannot be bothered to explain more and proceed to blast through all the technical stuff.

text: Oh man now I definitely feel stupid. Thank you!

elements.text: Oh man now I definitely feel stupid. Thank you!

text: <@U6788D83U> that’s very relatable. It’s hard to write good docs without explicit revision/content advice, which I feel like you have to ask someone to go through and check for you. I’m guilty of reading docs and thinking “these are bad” without considering to open an issue and explain what didn’t work for me.

elements.text: that’s very relatable. It’s hard to write good docs without explicit revision/content advice, which I feel like you have to ask someone to go through and check for you. text: Yesterday my wife asked me how to figure out how big a drill bit to use for a pilot hole and handed me a guess at a bit and a screw. I said “I look at them like... yup these look good.”

elements.text: Yesterday my wife asked me how to figure out how big a drill bit to use for a pilot hole and handed me a guess at a bit and a screw. I said “I look at them like... yup these look good.”

text: She didn’t think it was as funny as I did once I realized what I had said.

elements.text: She didn’t think it was as funny as I did once I realized what I had said.
